page.title: 13Bevere Vivis Group
page.content: Mrs H Chapman started an art group in 1974 after she had attended evening classes at Worcester Technical College, taken by Mr G Vivis after whom the group is named. She wished to continue her hobby within an organized, informal group. Her home was large enough to accommodate the group. They originally used the attic which they painted white yo relfect the light, as a studio. From this a flourishing centre has developed. Courses now include pottery, painting, lace making, batik, caligraphy, flower arrangements and hobby ceramics. Fees, formerly 50p per session, now vary according to the course taken. Other rooms are now used and children's courses are most popular.
